result.execSummary:
The defendant David L Semrau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders bond on file to be applied. Costs are paid in full.
With Huber and Good Time Credit.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David L Semrau

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 2:44 pm case called. Defendant David L Semrau in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Anderson states agreement on record. Attorney Zamzow concurs.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Zamzow. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 15 days WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit of 1 day served. To begin no later than December 1, 2015. Costs to be applied. DNA surcharge and sample. Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow in court appears telephonically.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Zamzow requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Zamzow requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 02:55 pm.
from Atty Blum Re: Def's Phone Appearance for 7/28/2015 IA - Request Granted by the Court

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 1:28 PM: Defendant David L Semrau in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wishes to have counsel and is trying to find an attorney - unknown if he will have retainer funds.  Def is referred to SPD for eligibility.  NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
